prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant until a year ago. Now she's training to be a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Dr. Turner Grey
Description: The director of the Grey Surgical Clinic where the malpractice incident occurred.
Character 2
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Ran away as soon as she saw me. A girl who is Maya's little cousin.
Character 3
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Maya's aunt. She has a strange, powerful aura about her.
Character 4
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Claims to be an investigative photographer. She lives for the next big scoop.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Ini Miney
Description: College student. A huge fan of the occult and is doing research in parapsychology.
Character 7
Name: Mimi Miney
Description: Died in a car accident 1 year ago. Was Ini's older sister, nurse at Dr. Grey's clinic.
Character 8
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister. She was a top notch lawyer and my mentor and friend forever.
Character 9
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Became a prosecutor in Germany at age 13. A prodigy who has never known defeat.
Character 10
Name: Ami Fey
Description: Kurain Channeling Technique founder. Legend says her soul is sealed in the Sacred Urn.
Character 11
Name: Director Hotti (purported)
Description: A peculiar patient who claims to be Director Hotti. Seems to be extremely "healthy".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Guidemap (Fey Manor)
Description: A diagram of Fey Manor. Meditation room to the south. Channeling chamber north of meditation room. Side room to the east, have to go through winding path from meditation room to get to side room.
Evidence 2
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It's small, but it has a deep, profound aura about it. Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.
Evidence 3
Name: Newspaper Clipping 1
Description: One year ago on May 2nd, 14 patients died from malpractice at Grey Surgical Clinic.
Evidence 4
Name: Folding Screen
Description: About 8 inches off the ground is a small hole that looks like a bullet hole.
Evidence 5
Name: Black Key
Description: An old steel key. A green jewel is set in the center of the key's grip.
Evidence 6
Name: Newspaper Clipping 2
Description: Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. [info] This is a newspaper clipping about the death of Mimi Miney, the nurse who worked at Turner Grey's clinic. It reads how Mimi died as a result of her car crashing when she fell asleep at the wheel and Director Hotti fills in some further parts of the article later on. The content is as follows-Highway of Nightmares-May 24 - Late last night, two women's car crashed into a highway center divide. One of the women was not able to escape the flaming wreckage and died at the site. Ongoing investigation has revealed that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel. -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else. -Doctor Lurking in the Shadows? If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. Mimi Miney was the nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic where 14 patients were accidentally overdosed to their death. Is this then, just a mere coincidence...? 
Evidence 7
Name: Floor Plans (Crime Scene)
Description: A diagram of the Channeling Chamber. A four sectioned mat in front of a platform at the head.
Evidence 8
Name: Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report
Description: After being stabbed in the chest, he was shot in the forehead at point-blank. Stabbed in chest then shot at point-blank. Gunpowder residue around bullet hole.
Evidence 9
Name: Pistol
Description: Murder weapon. Was Grey's. Two shots fired. Bears Maya's and Grey's fingerprints.
Evidence 10
Name: Knife
Description: Murder weapon. A small fruit knife. Belongs to the Fey's. Bears Maya's fingerprints.
Evidence 11
Name: Maya's Costume
Description: Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. There are blood splatters on it. Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. This is Maya's robe that she wore on the day of Turner Grey's murder. It is stained with blood splatter and a bullet hole is present in the sleeve. The robe is otherwise clean. It is purple in color.
Evidence 12
Name: Lotta's Photo 1
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is a photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot.
Evidence 13
Name: Lotta's Photo 2
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. [caption] This is the second photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot behind her. Maya Fey is standing, pistol in hand, wearing a blood-splattered robe.
Evidence 14
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: Ami Fey's spirit is sealed within. It's chipped and cracked all over. Broken by Pearl right before the murder. Under repair in the hallway until police came.
Evidence 15
Name: Cloth Scrap
Description: Unburned remains found inside the garden incinerator. Small amount of blood is on it.
Evidence 16
Name: Pearl's Ball
Description: Pearl's favorite toy. She was playing with this at the time of the murder, it seems.
Evidence 17
Name: Clothing Box
Description: There is a hole that looks like a bullet hole about 8 inches off the ground.
Evidence 18
Name: License Photo
Description: Ini's photo for her driver's license. Director Hotti's treasured possession.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Like, when the channeling started, I was, like, sleeping in the Side Room.
Person: Ini
Testimony 1
Testimony: Like, a little later, someone came into the room, like, really suddenly.
Person: Ini
Testimony 2
Testimony: It was, like, oh my gawd, totally my sister!
Person: Ini
Testimony 3
Testimony: I, like, hadn't seen her in, like, so long... I was so happy in, like, a sad way...
Person: Ini
Testimony 4
Testimony: I wasn't, like, scared at all. And, like, her costume looked totally, like, normal.
Person: Ini
Testimony 5
Testimony: My sister... She, like, told me something, like, totally terrible.
Person: Ini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The task is to find one pair where the evidence contradicts the testimony.

First, let me go through the testimonies. The testimonies are from Ini Miney (Character 6). Testimony 0 says she was sleeping in the Side Room during the channeling. Testimony 1 mentions someone entering the room suddenly. Testimony 2 claims that person was her sister, Mimi Miney. Wait, but Mimi is dead, right? Evidence 6 is the newspaper clipping about Mimi's death a year ago. So if Ini says she saw her sister, that's impossible because Mimi is dead. But then, maybe there's something else here. Wait, maybe channeling? But the Sacred Urn (Evidence 14) is broken, so maybe they can't channel Ami Fey's spirit, but Mimi's? 

Looking at the evidence, Evidence 6 states that Mimi died in a car accident a year ago. So if Ini Testimony 2 says she saw her sister, that's a contradiction unless there's a channeling involved. But in the channeling, the Sacred Urn was broken (Evidence 14), which was under repair. So maybe the channeling wasn't possible. Also, the autopsy report (Evidence 8) says Dr. Grey was stabbed then shot. The pistol (Evidence 9) has Maya and Grey's fingerprints, and the knife (Evidence 10) has Maya's. But the key contradiction is about Mimi being alive. So Ini's testimony 2 claims she saw Mimi, but Evidence 6 says Mimi is dead. So that's a direct contradiction. Therefore, Evidence 6 (Newspaper Clipping 2) contradicts Testimony 2 (claiming she saw Mimi). That's the pair.

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to go through each testimony and check against the evidences to find inconsistencies.

First, looking at the testimonies given by Ini. Testimony 3 says she took her sister to the Channeling Chamber. Wait, but according to the evidence, Mimi Miney (her sister) died a year ago in a car accident. Evidence 6's newspaper clipping states that Mimi died in that crash. So if Mimi is dead, how could Ini take her sister to the Channeling Chamber now? That seems impossible. Maybe Ini is lying or mistaken, but the evidence clearly shows Mimi is deceased. 

So the contradiction here is between Testimony 3 (Ini claims she took her sister to the Chamber) and Evidence 6 (which confirms Mimi's death a year prior). That means Ini's testimony can't be true if her sister is already dead. Therefore, these two contradict each other.

cot:
Okay, let me try to figure this out. I need to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies provided. Let me start by reviewing the testimonies and the evidences to see where there's a conflict.

First, looking at the testimonies, all of them are from Ini Miney (Testimony 0 to 6). The key points from her testimonies are about the car accident involving her sister Mimi. She mentions that on the night of the accident, her sister was driving and was very tired. Ini fell asleep in the passenger seat, woke up when the crash happened, escaped the car, and that she didn't have a driver's license to take over driving.

Now, looking at the evidences, especially Evidence 6, which is the newspaper clipping about the accident. The article states that Ini Miney gave an interview where she said, "I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash..." But according to her testimony (Testimony 3), Ini says she fell asleep in the passenger seat. However, the newspaper article quotes Ini as saying she was the one driving and fell asleep. Wait, that's conflicting. Wait, wait, no. Let me read that again.

Wait, the newspaper clipping says: "If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney." So according to the article, Ini claims that Mimi was driving. But in her testimonies here, Ini says that her sister was driving, and she was the passenger. So that seems consistent. Hmm. Maybe I need to check again.

Wait, the article says that the driver was Mimi, but in the interview, Ini says she was the one who was tired and fell asleep. Wait, the article's quote from Ini is: "I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else." So Ini is saying she was the one who was tired and fell asleep. But if she was the passenger, then why is she saying she fell asleep? Wait, but if Mimi was driving, then Ini being the passenger could still fall asleep. Wait, maybe the contradiction is elsewhere.

Wait, no. Let me check the testimony again. Testimony 2 says: "the night of the accident, my sis was totally tired while she was driving." Testimony 3: "I was, like, totally pooped too, so I, like, fell asleep in the passenger's seat..." So Ini is stating that her sister was driving and got tired, and Ini was the passenger who fell asleep. But in the newspaper article, the quote from Ini implies that she (Ini) was the one who was driving? Wait, no. The article says that if Ini is to be believed, the driver was Mimi. But the quote from Ini in the article says "I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash..." Wait, if Ini was the passenger, then her falling asleep wouldn't affect the driving. But if she's the driver, falling asleep would cause the crash. But according to the testimonies, Ini says Mimi was driving. So the contradiction here is that the newspaper article's quote from Ini suggests she was the driver (since she said she fell asleep while driving?), but in her testimony, she claims Mimi was driving. Therefore, the article (Evidence 6) contradicts her testimony where she says Mimi was driving (Testimony 2, perhaps? Or maybe Testimony 3).

Wait, let me clarify. The article's content says that according to Ini's interview, she was the driver, which contradicts her testimony where she says Mimi was driving. But in the article, it's stated that Ini claims her sister was driving. Wait, no. The article's text says: "If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney." So the article is saying that Ini said Mimi was driving, which aligns with her testimonies here. But the quote from Ini in the article says, "I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash..." So if Ini was the passenger, why is she saying she fell asleep? That's not contradictory. Because she could be a passenger who fell asleep. But if the article is presenting her statement as the driver, then there's a problem. Wait, perhaps the article's quote is actually from Mimi, but that's not possible because Mimi died. Alternatively, maybe Ini's statement in the article is conflicting with her testimony. Let me read the evidence again.

Evidence 6's content: the article quotes Ini as saying she was tired, fell asleep, then the crash happened. But according to her testimonies (Testimony 2 and 3), Mimi was driving and fell asleep, while Ini was the passenger who also fell asleep. Wait, no. Testimony 2 says her sister was driving and was tired. Testimony 3 says Ini was in the passenger seat and fell asleep. But the article's quote from Ini says she (Ini) was the one who fell asleep, leading to the crash. That would imply Ini was driving. But in the testimonies, Ini says Mimi was driving. So here's the contradiction: in the testimonies, Ini says Mimi was driving and was tired, leading to the crash. But the newspaper article's quote from Ini makes it sound like she was the driver who fell asleep, which would be a contradiction. Therefore, Evidence 6 (the newspaper clipping) contradicts Testimony 2 or 3. 

Wait, Testimony 2: "the night of the accident, my sis was totally tired while she was driving." So Ini claims Mimi was driving. But the newspaper article's quote from Ini implies that she (Ini) was the one driving. Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 6 (the article quoting Ini as the driver) and Testimony 2 (Ini claiming Mimi was driving). But wait, the article's actual text says, "If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney." Then the article's quote from Ini is her own account where she says she fell asleep. So there's a possible inconsistency here. If the article says that Ini claims Mimi was driving, but Ini's own quote in the article says she fell asleep (as the driver?), then that's a contradiction. Alternatively, maybe the article is misrepresenting her statement. Let me parse this carefully.

The article's structure: 
- First part describes the crash, driver fell asleep.
- Then a section titled "Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash" where Ini is quoted as saying: "I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else."
- Then the article speculates: "If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney." So the article is inferring that because Ini's sister was Mimi, and Mimi was the nurse at the clinic, then perhaps the driver was Mimi. But Ini's own statement in the interview doesn't explicitly state who was driving. However, if Ini was in the passenger seat, she could have fallen asleep, and Mimi was driving. So why would the article quote her as saying she fell asleep leading to the crash? Because if she was the passenger, her falling asleep wouldn't cause the crash. Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and they want one pair where evidence and testimony don't match up.

First, let me go through the testimonies. The testimonies are all from Ini, Testimony 0 to 5. Let me read each one.

Testimony 3 says: "My sis' new car was, like, a totally special model from England." So Ini claims that her sister Mimi's car was a special model from England.

Now, looking at the evidences. Evidence 6 is the Newspaper Clipping 2 about the car accident. It mentions that Ini was in the car crash, and according to the article, the car was a "shiny, bright red sports car." Wait, the article also has a part where Director Hotti filled in some details. Wait, let me check the exact description. 

Evidence 6's description states: "Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. [...] -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. [...] If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. [...] The content mentions that the car was a bright red sports car. But in Testimony 3, Ini says it's a special model from England. However, in the evidence, there's no mention of the car being from England. Wait, but maybe there's something else. Wait, maybe the driver's license photo? Let's check Evidence 18: License Photo is Ini's driver's license photo, which Director Hotti has. But how does that connect?

Wait, the contradiction is that Ini claims in Testimony 3 that the car was a special model from England. But Evidence 6's article quotes Ini as saying "I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out." Wait, in countries where cars are right-hand drive, like England, the driver's seat is on the right side. So if the car was from England, it would be right-hand drive, which would mean the driver (Mimi) would be on the right side. But in the accident, Ini says she opened the right door to get out. If the car was a right-hand drive (from England), the passenger's door would be on the left. Wait, no, in right-hand drive cars, the driver is on the right, so the passenger door is on the left. So if Ini was in the passenger seat, she would exit through the left door. But she says she opened the right door. That would mean the passenger door is on the right, which is the case in left-hand drive cars (like in the US). So if the car was a right-hand drive (from England), the passenger door is on the left. So if Ini opened the right door, that would be the driver's side. But she was in the passenger seat, so she should have exited the left door. Therefore, if the car was from England (right-hand drive), Ini's statement about opening the right door contradicts that, indicating the car is left-hand drive. Thus, Testimony 3 (car from England) contradicts Evidence 6's account where she opened the right door as a passenger, implying left-hand drive. Therefore, the car couldn't be from England if she opened the right door as a passenger. So Testimony 3 and Evidence 6 contradict each other.
